big_picture: Key policy developments in India today focus on law enforcement and governance. The Union Minister for Home & Cooperation, Amit Shah, led a consultative committee on cybercrime, highlighting the need for a robust response to emerging threats. Meanwhile, high courts in Jammu and Kashmir, Delhi, and Gujarat have issued notices on various petitions, including one related to the non-implementation of the Public Service Guarantee Act in J&K, and another challenging a law allowing police to collect DNA and biometric data of accused individuals. These judicial interventions underscore the ongoing efforts to address governance and law enforcement issues in the country.

The visit is seen as an opportunity to elevate their relationship to a "special strategic partnership." This development comes amidst heightened tensions in the region, particularly between the US and Iran.

story_clusters.summary: The Jerusalem Post featured a "Welcome Modi" front page ahead of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Israel. The front page included a message in both English and Hebrew, with the phrase "Namaste, Shalom" to mark the occasion. This gesture was seen as a sign of the strong ties between India and Israel.

articles.title: Sweeping tariffs gone but Trump's 15% global tariffs on. What to expect from markets on Monday?

articles.title: The Powerplay of Meat and Politics in India

articles.title: Softer dollar, modest inflows offer breathing room to Indian rupee
